#summary This page describes the PrAuth protocol, then when implemented by identity providers, can easily allow web services to use the same authentication mechanism for their users belonging to that identity provider organization.

= Introduction =

The basis of PrAuth is a shared secret and a use once token exchanged between the identity provider and the service provider.

The users of this protocol are defined as follows:
  # *Organization*: The identity provider that has a authentication system in place.
  # *User*: The person trying to access the web service using the identity provider.
  # *Service*: The web app that wants to use the organization authentication system to authenticate the user for its web service.
